intro: Parnassia ciliata, commonly known as the silky parnassia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and North America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wet meadows. Its leaves are palmately divided and have a soft, hairy texture. Parnassia ciliata is noted for its ornamental value and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions.
